result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Constance K Shaw

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for In Camera Inspection Pursuant to Shiffra/Green, filed by Atty Herbers

8:38 AM Defendant Constance K Shaw in court. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 

Defense is continuing investigation, and is still in process of receiving digital discovery. Defense asks for new date. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:17 AM Defendant Constance K Shaw not in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Constance K Shaw. Authorization to appear received and filed. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Atty Hughes requests more time for his investigator to conclude investigation, has discovery and an offer from the State.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:12 AM Defendant Constance K Shaw in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 1st, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
